content.text: This controls which statuses are available for your assets, and you can create new statuses or edit existing ones.

Inactive status   icon - this indicates the status is inactive in the system but it can still have work orders created, but their PMs (on their Maintenance Plans) will not come be included on the PM Management board (thus, not be eligible to be automatically turned into a work).

content.title: Create, Edit, or Delete a Category or Subcategory.

content.text: Category Settings establish what kinds of assets you can create in the Assets module.
1. Navigate to Settings > Module Settings > Assets.
2. Click the Category Settings tab.
3. There are three levels to all assets:  Class > Category > Sub Category.
View the image(s) below:.
All categories fall into one of four different Classes.
1. Fixed Equipment - This is the default class. Assets imported into the application (no matter the category) will land here.
2. Fleet.
3. Mobile Equipment.
4. Facilities.
The relationship between category and subcategory is the most important when setting up your assets.

There is no limit to the number of Subcategories that can be added to a Category. They cannot be moved to another Category. If you change your mind and want a Subcategory placed under a different Category, it must be created under that other Category.
1. Select the Class the category will be under.
2. In the Category drop-down, enter the new category name.
View the image(s) below:.
3. Press the Enter key or click [+] category name.
1. For the category you want to edit, from the Category drop-down, select the category name.
2. Click the edit category name link.
3. Change the category's name.
4. Press the Enter key or click off the name.
You can only delete a category that has no historical record.
1. For the category you want to delete, from the Category drop-down, select the category name.
2. Click the delete link.

There is no limit to the number of Subcategories that can be added to a Category. They cannot be moved to another Category. If you change your mind and want a Subcategory placed under a different Category, it must be created under that other Category.
First select the desired Category.
1. Click the + button under Add Sub Category.
View the image(s) below:.
2. In the enter name field, enter the new subcategory name.
3. Press the Enter key or click off the name.
1. From the subcategory list, click the category name. The subcategory setup form displays.
2. Edit the subcategory's name, change the axle schema, or custom fields.
You can only delete a subcategory that has no historical record.
1. From the subcategory list, click the category name. The subcategory setup form displays.
2. Click the delete link. The subcategory is deleted.

content.title: Add a Meter and Fluid Log to a Category.

content.text: Meters and Logs are established at the Category level. They apply to all Subcategories and all Assets listed under the selected Category.
1. Navigate Settings > Module Settings > Assets.
2. Click the Category Settings tab.
Meters and Logs are established at the Category level. They apply to all Subcategories and all Assets listed under the selected Category.
View the image(s) below:.

content.title: Add a Meter of Fluid Log to a Category.

content.text: 1. From the Select a meter drop-down, select from the options.
2. To remove a Meter from a Category, select a visible meter. It will display the Minimum/Maximum settings for the Meter. At the top of the window, click on remove from category.
To establish a Minimum/Maximum level that will restrict the acceptable entries for a Meter on that Category, select a visible meter. It will display the Minimum/Maximum settings for the Meter.
3. Enter the numeric value.
4. Press the Enter key.

content.title: Create a new Meter or Fluid Log.

content.text: 1. Click the Manage button. It will display all available Meters.
2. Under the New Meter or Log, click the Add + icon.
Decide which type of meter you want from the following options:.
Fluid.
Gauge.
Trip meter.
Meter.
View the image(s) below:.
Enter the name of the new log.
3. Press the Enter button.
1. There are two System Managed Logs that can be selected. Both logs are System Managed, and cannot be altered or renamed.
They are pre-set to operate a certain way, and require additional consideration:.
2. Distance:  This meter will track the distance traveled on a set of tires, in the Tire Tracking application.

3. Distance log's availability is established at the Site level by your System Administrator. Go to Settings > Administration > Sites. When you select your site, the details of the site will appear. Under Distance Unit you can decide if your distances will be measured in Metric or Imperial standards. Keep in mind, that this will be your standard across the entire Site. Multiple sites can have different Distance standards.
View the image(s) below:.
4. Trip Distance:  This is the trip meter, as seen on most vehicles. It is recommended that this be tracked separately from the main vehicle odometer.
View the image(s) below:.
Each Category has six standard fields available to it:.
In Service Date.
Manufacturer.
Model.
Year.
1. Serial # (With Categories under the FLEET Class, this will appear as VIN #).
Vendor.
By default, all six are made visible for any Asset assigned to that Category. These are all optional fields, when you create or edit an Asset.
2. Navigate to Settings > Module Settings > Assets.
3. Click Category Settings tab.
View the image(s) below:.
Make a Standard Field visible or invisible.

Make a Standard Field mandatory or optional.

content.title: Create an Axle Schema for Tire Tracking.

content.text: Eptura Asset includes commonly used axle schemas. If you need a new schema then you can quickly create a new one.
1. Navigate to Settings > Module Settings > Assets.
2. Click the Category Settings tab.
3. From the Class drop-down, select a Class.
4. Tire tracking is only available for Categories under the FLEET or MOBILE EQUIPMENT Classes.
5. From a Category drop-down, select a Category.
6. Ensure tire tracking is toggled on for each desired Category under that Class.
Click an existing sub-category or create a sub-category. In this example we clicked a sub-category and the form displays.
View the image(s) below:.
7. Click the Select default schema button.
Click on "create a new axle schema" to populate the new axle schema form.
View the image(s) below:.
The Create Axle Schema form displays.
View the image(s) below:.
8. In the Axle Schema Name field, enter the schema's name.
9. Click Add Axle +. The axle types display.
View the image(s) below:.
10. Click on an axle type to populate the tire configuration.
View the image(s) below:.
11. To add another set of tires to the axle, click the + icon.
View the image(s) below:.
The additional tires display.
View the image(s) below:.
12. Click the Save button. The new axle displays and can be selected.
View the image(s) below:.

content.title: Set up an Axle Schema for Tire Tracking.

content.text: The Category settings is where the default Axle Schema is defined for each asset subcategory with Tire Tracking enabled. This is useful when you have the same axle schema for multiple vehicles.
Complete the following steps:.
1. Step 1. Enable Tire Tracking.
2. Step 2. Set a default Axle Schema.
1. Navigate to Settings > Module Settings > Assets > Category Settings.
2. From the Class drop-down, select a Class.
3. Tire tracking is only available for Categories under the FLEET or MOBILE EQUIPMENT Classes.
4. From a Category drop-down, select a Category.
5. Ensure tire tracking is toggled on for each desired Category under that Class.
View the image(s) below:.

content.title: Step 2. Set a default Axle Schema.

content.text: View the image(s) below:.
Click an existing subcategory or create a subcategory. In this example we clicked a subcategory and the form displays.
View the image(s) below:.
1. Click the select default schema button. The axle configuration dialog displays.
View the image(s) below:.
2. Click one of the default axle schemas or create a new axle schema. The set as default dialog displays with the message "set this schema for all assets with the same sub-category. ".
View the image(s) below:.
3. Click the Yes button to set the default schema for the subcategory. The default schema is set and automatically saved.
Now that the default axle schema is set, assets associated with the subcategory will automatically follow the selected default axle schema.
